alert.note: Alert for Carver; Dakota; Hennepin; Scott (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 9:48AM CDT until May 07 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Granite Falls HWY 212 affecting Yellow Medicine, Chippewa and Renville Counties. Minnesota River at Morton affecting Redwood and Renville Counties. Minnesota River at Savage affecting Scott, Carver, Dakota and Hennepin Counties. Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Yellow Medicine, Chippewa and Lac qui Parle Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Minnesota and Wisconsin... Mississippi River near Hastings L/D 2 (COE) affecting Dakota, Pierce, Goodhue and Washington Counties. .Several chances of precipitation are expected through the weekend. A half inch to an inch of rainfall area-wide seems like a good bet. Localized areas could see 2 inches to perhaps even 3 inches, if any training thunderstorms occur. However, these higher amounts should be sparse and area river levels should still generally decrease. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Savage. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 702.0 feet, Barge loading affected at Port Cargill, and other flood prevention measures are begun. Water begins to impact Black Dog Road in Burnsville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 AM CDT Friday, the stage was 702.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 900 AM CDT Friday was 703.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 698.5 feet next Friday morning. - Flood stage is 702.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 702.8 feet on 10/01/1986. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
